intro: Manglietia insignis, commonly known as the "Queen of the Night," is a striking tropical plant native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It is a large, evergreen tree that can grow up to 30 meters tall, with thick, dark green leaves and fragrant, white flowers that bloom at night. The plant belongs to the family Magnoliaceae, which includes some of the most ancient flowering plants. Its flowers emit a strong, sweet scent to attract nocturnal pollinators like moths. Due to its rarity and unique characteristics, it is considered a valuable species in botanical research and conservation efforts.
